name: Sacred Canyon Lodge

reviews.text: Thunderbird gives front row access to Canyon's south edge. 8 yr old grandson & I were just a stair flight from sweeping sunrise; great to share his first trip while dad & grandad slept very comfortably. Room decor itself quite pleasant, very clean, walk to restaurants. Also enjoyed Bright Angel Inn one summer; Thunderbird more spacious for family, better view from room itself - ask for 2d flr at reservation.
reviews.title: Perfect Place

likes.liked: — view, western new decoration, green cups
likes.disliked: — dingy hallway carpet, long walk to vending area

reviews.text: Quaint adobe look, clean, quiet great location for a tour of the Canyon! The REALLY BAD THING WAS they close the tour gift shop before the tour gets back DUH DUH DUH can you figure this one out?? We had a group of 10 all eager to buy t shirts postcards etc. In fact my son was collecting pins from each place we stopped, not here they were CLOSED! We were able to buy a couple of postcards from the hotel desk, but had to wait for guests checking in. I think it would be a money make to add an extra hours or so to the end of the day in the TOUR GIFT SHOP.
reviews.title: Loved Thunderbird Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights in early September. Lodge upgraded us to a Suite which was very nice. Outsides of buildings look old but insides are fully remodeled and pleasant. Wireless internet worked fine. Cafeteria is good for breakfasts. No fine dining available anywhere around. Many local Navajos eat at the Lodge cafeteria. Staff was fine. You have to understand you are on the Navajo Nation and their culture is just a bit different. They aren't overly warm and open. Don't let it bother you.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: We had a 3 hour Jeep tour of the canyon by an off-Lodge tour guide. Get info at the visitor's center. It is a very interesting area to visit.
reviews.title: Rude Staff

reviews.text: 2 other things I didn't know: the Navajo Nation observes Daylight Savings Time, while the rest of Arizona doesn't. And, alcohol is prohibited on the Navajo Nation.
reviews.title: Basic motel w/ nice updates & wonderful location
Nice and quiet in Chinle
reviews.text: Anyone expecting anything other other than a nice, quiet simple little motel is going to be disappointed. My family and I enjoyed our 2 night stay there very much. We made arrangements with a private navajo guide for a jeep tour of the canyon (worth every penny) and toured the area our first day via our own car. I would not recommend eating at the restaurant as the food looks really boring and out of a can. The other 2 motels in the area aren't much better. We ended up eating at the local Burger King and A & W. Pretty bad stuff but at least you know what you're getting. If your expectations are reasonable then you'll enjoy the Thunderbird Inn. One final note: I wouldn't arrange a tour of the canyon with the motel. They use old, and exposed, jeep /truck related vehicles which have to many people on them and it can get really dusty in the canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Thunderbird is the kind of place I could spend a week - comfortable grounds, polite staff, clean room, and I love the cafeteria and gift shop. The tour is fun - I'd recommend the half day - it is plenty of bouncing around.
reviews.title: I love this place!

reviews.text: We reserved two Canyon facing rooms at the Thunderbird Lodge. We got adjoining rooms which was really nice. The rooms were renovated and spacious - both were quite comfortable. We ate dinner at the Bright Angel restaurant which was very sartisfactory. The only negative I can think of is the parking. We had to park up by the El Tovar Hotel and walk down to the Bright Angel to register. There were absolutely NO parking spaces - we were lucky to snag the one parking place we did! We asked about parking when checking in and were told that there was no special parking for hotel guests, it was a free-for-all for anyone who wanted to park there. We had to schlep all of our luggage about 1/4 mile up and down stairs (no elevators) - it seems that they could at least have some of the parking spaces around the lodges designated for guests - afterall you pay about $120 per night per room. Once in your room, the shuttle system will take you anywhere you need to go. We wanted to do laundry our first night in, but we were afraid to give up our parking space - now that is really bad!
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay
Thunderbird Lodge - A Pleasant Surprise!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Thunderbird lodge for 2 nights. We found it to be pleasantly surprising. Do not let the 1 star rating deter you from staying at Thunderbird.
Although it is not a 5 star resort, the canyon speaks for itself and the Thunderbird proved to be a good value for us.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Chinle
Closest to Canyon de Chelly
reviews.text: My family and I have been staying here since 1980. It is very basic but well maintained. It was originally a trading post and was renovated by the CCC and turned into a Motel. The rooms are basic but clean . The Motel has some ambiance because of its construction which looks exactly what you would expect when you know its history. It is right by the Park entrance to Canyon de Chelly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has a restaurant which is self service cafeteria style although the quality is quite high and there are some " cooked to order " dishes. There is no alcohol like all restaurants on the Navajo Reservation. It is possible to take on the reservation wine ( in those four pack small bottles ) and then take them into the restaurant in your pocket and simply, although surreptitiously, fill a paper cup. This is of course illegal and I would never recommend it although I have seen people do it.
reviews.title: prefect location

likes.disliked: — take a helicopter tour of the canyon

reviews.title: Basic but had everything we needed
reviews.text: The majestic views of the Canyon are wonderful and the advertised tour by four wheel drive truck is well worth doing and is the only example I have ever seen where you could not travel without a high wheel base four wheel drive. Because of its position I would highly recommend it.

we stayed here for one night during our tour of the us. we chose the hotel because of the incredible location right on the rim we wanted to be there for the sunset and sunrise over the canyon. we were not dissappointed as the views were unbelievable, the changing colours of the canyon were unmissable. we were able to walk part way down the bright angel trail you can hike all the way down but we arent the fittest people and you need to be pretty fit to get back to the top. the room was lovely one of the nicest we stayed in very clean, the hotel shares the amenities of the bright angel lodge which is directly next door. for an unforgetable experience at the canyon stay here its excellant
reviews.title: Best Location for Canyon De Chelly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of December and although it is a basic motel - functional rooms but clean, cafeteria style restaurant - it had everything we needed as a base for seeing the Canyon and as somewhere to be overnight as all day we were out at the Canyon.
reviews.title: Basic Motel Lodge

reviews.text: I was disappointed with this hotel for several reasons. It is a dated motel right on the rim of the canyon. In our room several ammenities were broken: one dresser draw fell apart when I opened it, and the safe never functioned. The response to our calls for assistance were prompt however, I felt that these problems should have been picked up prior to our arrival when the room was cleaned.
reviews.title: needed better upkeep

reviews.text: Also, although we had a great view, the motel did not have any common rooms or porches that in which patrons could sit. We went next door to the other hotels and used there chairs.
reviews.title: Great tour, poor lodge
A thundering disappointment
reviews.text: It was pleasant to be situated right on the rim so that access to dining and hiking was immediate.

A friend highly recommended the Canyon de Chelly tour run out of this lodge, so we opted to stay here a couple of nights on our family vacation. While the tour was great, the lodge was a huge disappointment. The room was adequate and reasonably clean; but the staff were surly and unpleasant, and the cafe was grossly overpriced and poor quality. Come for the tour, but stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Spartan Hotel - Incredible Location

likes.disliked: — Understand the parking situation before checking in

reviews.text: The staff were unhelpful and surly. The food is abominable -- it reminded me of a college dormitory food service, only worse. The wireless interact access doesn't work, and nobody cares. Shortened my trip because the place was such a major let-down. The location is great (except for the mosquitos) and the views are phenomenal. But you would probably be better off staying elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good for one night

likes.disliked: — Try to get canyon view, book early

description: The only accommodations inside Canyon de Chelly National Monument.
